events.title: Discovery of Gold at Sutter's Mill
events.description: James W. Marshall discovered gold at Sutter's Mill in California, sparking the California Gold Rush.
events.significance: This discovery led to a massive migration westward, accelerating California's statehood and impacting the US economy and demographics.

events.title: Sir Winston Churchill Dies
events.description: Sir Winston Churchill, former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom during WWII, passed away at age 90.
events.significance: Churchill was a pivotal figure in 20th-century history, known for his leadership during WWII and shaping postwar Europe.

events.title: Apple Computer Unveils the Macintosh
events.description: Apple introduced the Macintosh personal computer with a graphical user interface in a famous Super Bowl commercial.
events.significance: The Macintosh revolutionized personal computing and popularized the graphical user interface, influencing modern computing design.

events.title: Peachy Keen by Billboard's Top 100
events.description: The Billboard Top 100 chart was first published on this date.
events.significance: The chart became a standard for measuring music popularity, influencing the music industry and culture.
